Responsive Design Canvas vs. Model-Driven:

'Before you build a canvas app in Power Apps, you specify whether to tailor the app for a phone or a tablet. This choice determines the size and shape of the canvas on which you'll build your app. After you make that choice, you can make a few more choices if you select Settings > Display. You can choose portrait or landscape orientation and screen size (tablet only). You can also lock or unlock the aspect ratio and support device rotation (or not).

Model-driven apps are also responsive by design and will render themselves according to whatever device you use.'

In the case of a specific tablet sized device (question 1), Canvas would be the answer, since you can set it to the exact size you need to build on.

You have the following requirements:

• Use a tool that identifies potential issues.
• Use a tool that provides suggestions for modifying the app.

You need a tool that meets the requirements.

Which tool should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The tool that meets the requirements of identifying potential issues and providing suggestions for modifying the app for screen reader support is:

D. Accessibility Checker

Explanation:
The Accessibility Checker is specifically designed to identify potential accessibility issues within apps and provides suggestions for modifying the app to ensure accessibility for users with disabilities, including those who use screen readers. This tool helps developers ensure that their canvas apps are accessible to users with visual impairments, meeting the requirements outlined in the scenario.

"Wenn Sie sich nicht sicher sind, wie Sie Ihre App barrierefreier gestalten können, können Sie die Barrierefreiheitsprüfung in Power Apps Studio ausführen.
